Example of Handling Unclear Etiology for an Arthritis Diagnosis
Situation
:  The Veteran sprained his left ankle during service with no further treatment or complaints for the remaining period of service.  The Veteran submitted private medical evidence showing a diagnosis of degenerative arthritis and provided a history of a left ankle sprain during service.
Result
:  The etiology of the Veteran’s arthritis is not clear.  Do not assume the arthritis is or is not related to the ankle sprain.  Since there is evidence of an in-service injury and a current diagnosis of arthritis involving the same joint, obtain a medical opinion to determine the etiology of the arthritis.
Important
:  If the resulting opinion links the in-service injury to the arthritis, evaluate the disability under
38 CFR 4.71a, DC 5010
(hyphenated with the DC for the predominant symptomatology).
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section C - Arthritis
